question.title: wicket extend checkbox two-state to multi state
question.body:
how to create a checkbox in wicket with multi state?

for example: checked, not checked and "no action" (with gray background)

public enum PageType {
    ABOUT(1),
    CODING(2),
    DATABASES(3);

    private int value; 

    private PageType(int value) {
        this.value = value;
    }
}

Checkbox<PageType> chbk = new Checkbox<>("checkbox");

answers.body:
Wicket-Bootstrap project provides such component that integrates with ttps://github.com/kartik-v/bootstrap-checkbox-x

Basically the JavaScript component sends 1 for checked, 0 for unchecked and null for nothing.

You can see the integration code at:

https://github.com/martin-g/wicket-bootstrap/blob/wicket-10.x-bootstrap-5.x/bootstrap-extensions/src/main/java/de/agilecoders/wicket/extensions/markup/html/bootstrap/form/checkboxx/CheckBoxX.java

If you build locally the samples app (https://github.com/martin-g/wicket-bootstrap/tree/wicket-10.x-bootstrap-5.x/bootstrap-samples) then you can see it in action at the Checkboxes demo page.
